document_name_accent: xuat huyet tu cung bat thuong.json
document_title: Abnormal uterine bleeding: Causes, diagnosis and treatment
subsection_content:
Abnormal uterine bleeding (the medical term is Abnormal Uterine Bleeding - AUB) is abnormal bleeding from the uterus, different from the characteristics of a normal menstrual cycle. (first)
Abnormal uterine bleeding is bleeding from the uterus that is abnormal, different from the normal menstrual cycle
This condition affects the health of about 1/3 of the population of women of reproductive age. Diagnosing the cause of this condition is quite difficult and complicated. Therefore, as soon as there are unusual symptoms, women should immediately go to a medical facility for timely treatment.
A menstrual cycle is counted from the first day of menstrual bleeding of one menstrual period until the first day of menstrual bleeding of the next menstrual period. Normally, the menstrual cycle lasts about 21 - 35 days, menstruation lasts about 3 - 8 days, the first days of menstruation are usually heavy, then gradually decrease and menstruation is complete. If the menstrual cycle is shorter than 21 days or lasts longer than 35 days, or changes without menstruation for 3 - 6 months (also known as amenorrhea), it must be considered abnormal.

subsection_data:

This condition affects the health of about 1/3 of the population of women of reproductive age. Diagnosing the cause of this condition is quite difficult and complicated. Therefore, as soon as there are unusual symptoms, women should immediately go to a medical facility for timely treatment.
A menstrual cycle is counted from the first day of menstrual bleeding of one menstrual period until the first day of menstrual bleeding of the next menstrual period. Normally, the menstrual cycle lasts about 21 - 35 days, menstruation lasts about 3 - 8 days, the first days of menstruation are usually heavy, then gradually decrease and menstruation is complete.
